data.title: The Marrow of Tradition Quizzes
data.meta_description: The Marrow of Tradition study guide contains a biography of Charles W. Chesnutt, literature essays, quiz questions, major themes, characters, and a full summary and analysis.
data.text:
The Marrow of Tradition Quiz 1

1 What is the name of the newspaper that Major Carteret operates?

The Morning Journal

The Evening Star

The Morning Chronicle

The Wilmington Gazette

2 In what army did Major Carteret serve in?

the United States Army

the Union Army

the Confederate Army

God's Army

3 Who kicked Julia and her child out of Mr. Merkell's house?

Major Carteret

Dr. Miller

Aunt Polly

Olivia Carteret

4 Who now owns the Carteret family estate?

Major Carteret

Mammy Jane

Dr. Miller

Mr. Merkell

5 For how long is Mrs. Carteret in labor with her first child?

two hours

nine hours

two days

three hours

6 What is Dodie Carteret's given name?

Matthew Paul

Theodore Felix

Matthew Thomas

Felix Paul

7 What is Lee Ellis' job at the town's newspaper?

copy boy

printer

reporter

editor

8 Where did Aunt Polly get the coins she used to pass out to Tom and Clara as children?

her mattress

her pine chest

her bank

her apron

9 For whom does Sandy work?

Old Mr. Delamere

Aunt Polly

Tom Delamere

the Carteret family

10 What traditional celebration does Major Carteret's news paper staff participate in after the birth of his son?

giving him a small sum of money

eating a corn cake

drinking a glass of wine

smoking a cigar

11 Why does Major Carteret not shake Jerry's hand?

he is black

he is a laborer

he is uneducated

he is a Republican

12 What military rank has Mr. Belmont attained?

Major

General

Private

Captain

13 What style of beard does Mr. Belmont wear?

Vandyke

Clean-shaven

Goatee

Burnside

14 Major Carteret's newspaper is the "organ" for which political party?

Republican

Democratic

Whigs

Bull Moose

15 Which man lets Jerry keep the change from their drink order?

Private Benjamin

Major Carteret

Captain McBane

General Belmont

16 How much does Dodie weigh after six months?

thirty four pounds

eighteen pounds

twenty four pounds

nine pounds

17 Why does Mammy Jane have to leave the Carteret residence?

rheumatism

her obstinate behavior

the flu

a bad back

18 What name does the narrator give for the Southern stage of race relations where there is an "imperfect blending of old with new..."

chip-on-the-shoulder

out-with-the-old

tossing-and-turning

new wineskins

19 According to Mammy Jane and Major Carteret, what is "spoiling" the "young negroes?"

money

self confidence

education

jobs

20 What does Mammy Jane put in the vial she buries in the Carteret's front yard?

blood

spit

dirt

bath water

21 What does Dodie accidentally swallow?

a piece of wood

a hard piece of candy

a piece of his rattle

a piece of plastic

22 From what city is Dr. Burns from?

Washington, D.C.

Philadelphia

New York

Wilmington

23 Where did Dr. Miller study medicine?

Europe

New York

Chicago

North Carolina

24 What system of laws designated strict seperation between races in the post Civil War South?

The Virginia Laws

Plessy v. Ferguson Laws

The Mosaic Laws

Jim Crow Laws

25 The book's title is based on a poem by what writer?

William Wordsworth

Charles Lamb

Robert Frost

Lord Byron
